name: Basil
description: The essence of fresh basil leaves, available in all seasons. Delicious with pasta, salad greens, dipping bread and sauces.

name: Baklouti Green Chili
description: Made by combining a pint of organic extra virgin olive oil with 1.6 pounds of fresh whole Baklouti chilies and crushing them for an amazing fusion.  Use (sparingly) to spice your dishes.

name: Blood Orange
description: Product of crushing just-picked oranges with just-picked olives. Toss with spinach for a light salad, rub on poultry, or use as a base for citrus mayonnaise. Pair with Succulent Fig, White Peach or Cranberry~Pear balsamics.

name: Buttery
description: Butter taste with all the health benefits of olive oil.  Use in baking to replace butter, make mashed potatoes, saut√© vegetables or grill fish or meat.  Fabulous drizzled over popcorn!

name: Fresh Garlic
description: TJust the right amount of garlic intensity. Toss with pasta; use in place of butter to make garlic bread; drizzle on steaks, soups and vegetables.  Pair with any aged balsamics.

name: Gremolata
description: Gremolata is a traditional Italian blend of lemon zest, garlic, parsley and mint. The infused olive oil is ideal for marinating poultry, veal or fish; in dressings paired with Alfoos Mango or Oregano balsamics; or tossed with pasta.

name: Herbes de Provence
description: Infused with notes of savory, thyme, basil, lavender and a hint of fennel.  Drizzle over grilled meat or fish, or create a salad dressing, paired with Lavender balsamic.

name: Meyer Lemon
description: Olives crushed with Meyer lemons, delicious with fish, chicken, and vegetables.  Pair with Black Currant or Pomegranate balsamic to create a salad sensation.

name: Persian Lime
description: Essence of limes perfects Mexican dishes, spicy Thai dishes, salads, and seafood.  Drizzle on an avocado. Substitute for butter in mashed sweet potatoes.  Pair with Honey Ginger balsamic for an Asian-fusion sensation.

name: Smokey Chipotle
description: Just the right amount of zip for Mexican dishes.  Also spices up pasta, sauces, and grilled vegetables.  Brush on grilled chicken, beef, or seafood.   Awesome on pizza!

name: Tuscan Herb
description: Fruity olive oil and the vibrant flavor of Tuscan herbs -- basil, rosemary, garlic, marjoram, and parsley.  Pair with pasta, dip bread, toss with salads, drizzle on grilled vegetables.

name: Wild Mushroom Sage
description: Subtle wild mushroom flavor, with savory hints of sage.  Ideal for potato and rice dishes, as well as roasted meats, pasta dishes, eggs, and savory dressings.

name: Wild Fernleaf Dill
description: Fresh dill flavor, especially good on salmon, in egg dishes, on green beans, and drizzled over roasted or boiled baby potatoes.  Pair with Sicilian Lemon balsamic.

name: Wild Rosemary
description: Like fresh-picked from the garden.  Add a dash to meat or pasta; drizzle over  potatoes; rub it into chicken before roasting.  Pair with Honey Ginger balsamic for a flavor burst.
